question_metadata.question_text: What prerequisites or conditions are necessary for the software business model as described in the article?

responses_by_article.article_title: A Pricing Framework for Software-as-a-Service
responses_by_article.question_text: What prerequisites or conditions are necessary for the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Multi-tenant architecture capability → enable single-versioned software for all clients
Remote hosting infrastructure → deploy software as hosted services accessible from remote locations
Internet connectivity → enable access to hosted services
Technology infrastructure management capability → manage hardware, software and professional services
Ability to provide supplementary services → backup, security, helpdesk, setup/training, configuration/integration
Sizeable client pool → achieve economies of scale necessary for sustainability
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 1: 'SaaS is outsourced software, meaning that both technology infrastructure and management - hardware, software and professional services - are contracted out to software vendors. Second, SaaS is remotely hosted, meaning that software are deployed as hosted services to be accessed by clients from remote locations. Third, SaaS is single versioned, meaning that there is only one version of software being accessed by every client at any moment in time. The multi-tenant architecture of SaaS benefits both clients and vendors alike' | Page 1: 'Software-as-a-Service (SaaS), "software deployed as a hosted service and accessed over the Internet"' | Page 1-2: 'software vendors would have to take into account not only the costs of hosting and maintaining the software, but also the costs associated with the provision of supplementary services (e.g., backup and security)' | Page 2: 'in order to retain a sizeable pool of clients and achieve economies of scale'

responses_by_article.article_title: Selection of the Proper Revenue and Pricing Model for SaaS
responses_by_article.question_text: What prerequisites or conditions are necessary for the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Cloud infrastructure (IaaS/PaaS) → Enable SaaS delivery and multi-tenant/multi-instance architecture
Multi-tenant or multi-instance software architecture → Support both rental and licensing models with same codebase
Network connectivity → Enable access to software through public cloud
Customer readiness for cloud technology → Adoption of SaaS model
For enterprise-SaaS: labor-intensive implementation capabilities → Enable integration with customer IT systems and create switching costs
For gaming platform: partnerships with network operators and content owners → Enable revenue sharing model
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 1: 'Cloud computing can be divided roughly into three service layers... (i) Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)... (ii) Platform as a Service (PaaS)... and (iii) Software as a Service (SaaS), which provides applications on top of PaaS and IaaS' | Page 3: 'From the outset, the software architecture was designed to be compatible with both software renting and software licensing' | Page 3: 'Another reason to sell a traditional license for internal use was a lack of network connections' | Page 3-4: 'Because the content is delivered through network operators to game players, the network operator determines the revenue model used'

responses_by_article.article_title: Transition to the Cloud: A Vendor Perspective
responses_by_article.question_text: What prerequisites or conditions are necessary for the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Organizational readiness for SaaS adoption → Customer capability to use cloud-based solutions
Product localization → Adjustment of SaaS products to local rules and contexts (financial procedures, regulations)
Partner capability transformation → VAR ability to shift from technical consulting to business process consulting
Mature cloud infrastructure → Underlying technology and network capabilities for reliable service delivery
Customer trust maintenance → Assurance of continued support for existing on-premise systems during transition
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 6, Section 5.2.2: 'ERP Co conducted a round of pilot implementation by selling 50 SaaS product to approved customers who met the criteria for SaaS implementation (in terms of organizational readiness for SaaS).' | Page 6, Section 5.2.1: 'Though they have acquired the SaaS software from US, they under-estimated the efforts in adjusting the product to local rules and contexts (e.g., certain financial procedures are very different in the US than in the Nordic countries).' | Page 7, Section 5.2.2: 'the services offered by partners should be shifted away from technical consulting towards business process consulting.'

responses_by_article.article_title: Managing a Software Business
responses_by_article.question_text: What prerequisites or conditions are necessary for the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Internet and cloud computing infrastructure → Enables service component delivery
Developer talent availability → Required for building the offering as strategic asset
Organizational structures that support developers → Enables developers to write great software
Live volunteer community for crowdsourcing → Required if choosing crowdsourcing strategy
Customer proximity to developers → Necessary for agile process
Culture of technical excellence → Required for agile process effectiveness
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 1: 'Thanks to the Internet and cloud computing, it's now easy to include a service component into any type of software.' | Page 4: 'set up your organization's structures in a way that lets them write great software' | Page 2: 'You can even crowdsource software development and support, but building and maintaining a live volunteer community isn't for the fainthearted.' | Page 3: 'Here, you must bring the customer close to the developers' | Page 3: 'promote a culture of technical excellence'

responses_by_article.article_title: Digital sustainable business models: Using digital technology to integrate ecological sustainability into the core of business models
responses_by_article.question_text: What prerequisites or conditions are necessary for the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Digital technology integration → Mediator, outcome, or ubiquity role of IT in BM (excludes facilitator role)
Ecological sustainable value proposition → Must address efficiency or effectiveness (equity excluded from scope)
Economic viability → Must be profit-driven and financially viable
Solidified business model → 4-10 years old to ensure BM stability
Data analytics capabilities → For sustainability intelligence and optimization
IoT infrastructure → For sensor networks and real-time monitoring
Sustainability science knowledge → To combine with data analytics for intelligence provision
Customer readiness for sustainable solutions → Market demand for ecological sustainability
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 7, Section 3.1: 'our analysis only includes start-ups that employ digital technologies as a fundamental part of their BM... we exclude BMs using digital technology as a facilitator for value creation' | 'we focus the scope of the sustainability dimension on efficiency and effectiveness (Chen et al., 2008). We exclude equity' | 'we look for financially viable BMs that are designed to be profit-driven to ensure that BMs are economically relevant' | Page 7, Section 3.2: 'We only included start-ups with ecological sustainable value propositions that are between 4 and 10 years old to ensure that they have solidified their BM'

responses_by_article.article_title: When does a freemium business model lead to high performance? — A qualitative comparative analysis based on fuzzy Sets
responses_by_article.question_text: What prerequisites or conditions are necessary for the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Dynamic capabilities → Sensing, seizing, and/or reconfiguring capabilities required for freemium models to lead to high performance
User base of sufficient size → Freemium products must attract disproportionately large user base to generate revenue
Network effects potential → Ability to benefit from increased user base
Free product offering → Must provide valuable free version to attract users
Premium features/modules → Must have differentiated paid features worth upgrading to
Digital platform infrastructure → Ability to deliver and distribute digitally
Ability to enhance network effects → Critical for conversion and user retention
Organizational readiness for innovation → Required for business model innovation
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 2, Section 1: 'Compared to paid products, freemium products must attract a disproportionately large user base to generate revenue and capture value' | Page 2: 'Freemium business models require dynamic capabilities and hypothesizes that higher performance can be achieved when freemium business models, dynamic capabilities, and environmental uncertainty interact' | Page 11: 'Bundled and fragmented freemium business models are a fundamental driver of enterprise performance and are necessary to bring about high enterprise performance, but they can only work in combination with dynamic capabilities and environmental uncertainty'

responses_by_article.article_title: Strategy and business model evolution at Adobe: Competing in digital media software industry
responses_by_article.question_text: What prerequisites or conditions are necessary for the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Cloud infrastructure partnerships → Scalable delivery
High-speed internet connectivity → Cloud service access
Customer trust in cloud security → Adoption
Technical expertise in cloud development → Product quality
Strong market position → Pricing power
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 6, Associates: 'Adobe needed new partners who could provide the required cloud infrastructure so that Adobe's continuously growing customer base does not face any performance issues.' | Page 2, Technology: 'worldwide internet bandwidth increased from 0.4 to 1.2 million Mbits/second' | Page 7, Challenges faced: 'Concerns included the privacy and security of creative assets stored in the creative cloud'

responses_by_article.article_title: Navigating the paradox of global scaling

extracted_value: Global business model in place → Enables replication across foreign markets

Non-location-bound firm-specific advantages → Reduces costs and friction of entering foreign markets

responses_by_article.article_title: Toward Building Specialized Information Systems as Software Platforms
responses_by_article.question_text: What prerequisites or conditions are necessary for the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Scalable and redundant data layer → Foundation for platform architecture
Shared data layer by multiple applications → Enables platform extensibility
Well-defined interface to database → Allows developers to focus on business logic
Consistent view of data → Provides semantic layer abstraction
Plugin architecture for UI elements → Enables modular presentation layer
Message bus for module communication → Prevents direct code access
Developer documentation for third parties → Enables external development
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 2: 'A software platform must have a data layer that is scalable and redundant.
